testcase.name: testAllByteBuffMethodsClass
testcase.system-out:
=== Testing class with ALL ByteBuf methods === Method: copy - Has ByteBuf: true Method: release - Has ByteBuf: true Method: allocate - Has ByteBuf: true
✓ Verified: All methods have ByteBuf in signature Expected: All methods will be instrumented

testcase.name: testNoByteBuffMethodsClass
testcase.system-out: === Testing class with NO ByteBuf methods === Method: getName - Has ByteBuf: false Method: setName - Has ByteBuf: false Method: calculate - Has ByteBuf: false ✓ Verified: NoByteBuffMethods has no ByteBuf methods Expected: This class should NOT be transformed by the agent Benefit: Mockito can mock this class without conflicts

testcase.name: testMySqlAccountStoreFactoryExample
testcase.system-out:
=== Testing MySqlAccountStoreFactory scenario === Scenario: MySqlAccountStoreFactory has ZERO ByteBuf methods Problem: Previously, ALL public/protected methods were transformed Result: Mockito 5 inline mocking failed with 'class redefinition failed'
Solution with method-level filtering: 1. Agent checks each method's signature for ByteBuf 2. No ByteBuf found → No methods are instrumented 3. Class is effectively not transformed 4. Mockito can mock the class without conflicts ✓
Expected behavior: - Classes with NO ByteBuf methods → Not transformed at all - Classes with SOME ByteBuf methods → Only those methods instrumented - Significant reduction in instrumentation overhead - No more Mockito conflicts for non-ByteBuf classes

testcase.name: testMySqlAccountStoreFactoryHasNoByteBuffMethods
testcase.system-out:
=== Verifying MySqlAccountStoreFactory has no ByteBuf methods === Methods in MySqlAccountStoreFactory: shutdown - Has ByteBuf: false initialize - Has ByteBuf: false getPoolSize - Has ByteBuf: false getConnectionString - Has ByteBuf: false setPoolSize - Has ByteBuf: false setConnectionString - Has ByteBuf: false
✓ Confirmed: MySqlAccountStoreFactory has ZERO ByteBuf methods Result: With method-level filtering, this class will NOT be transformed Mockito can now mock this class successfully!

testcase.name: testSomeByteBuffMethodsClass
testcase.system-out:
=== Testing class with SOME ByteBuf methods === Method: getName - Has ByteBuf: false Method: processWithMetadata - Has ByteBuf: true Method: setId - Has ByteBuf: false Method: processByteBuf - Has ByteBuf: true Method: createBuffer - Has ByteBuf: true Method: transformBuffer - Has ByteBuf: true
Methods with ByteBuf: 4 Methods without ByteBuf: 2
✓ Verified: Only ByteBuf methods will be instrumented Expected: Class is transformed, but only ByteBuf methods are intercepted Benefit: Reduced instrumentation overhead
